result.execSummary:
The defendant Cindy Lee Sturzl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/schooling or combination thereof, or for any week defendant does not comply with that condition, she must comoplete 9 hours community service per week.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO including but not limited to, AODA and any follow up. 

DNA sample.

Clerk Cheree
Cases17CF194 and 15CF1037 called: 8:28am
State appears by ADA K.Puig.  Def appears in person and with Atty Suzanne O'Neill.  
(Motion to Revoke DEJ in 15CF1037 and Plea/Sent in 17CF194)
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed in 17CF194.  VR not applicable

State notes parties stipulate to revocation of DEJ in 15CF1037 and entry of judgment on Ct. 1 in that case - COURT grants stipulation and enters judgment in Ct. 1 in 15CF1037.

17CF194>>
State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Possess Narcotic Drugs)>>D&RI
Ct. 2 (Felony Bail Jumping)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
17CF194 - Ct. 3 (Possession of THC)>> NO CONTEST
17CF194 - Ct. 4 (Possess Illegally Obtained Prescription)>> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held on all 3 counts; 15CF1037, Ct. 1>>2 years Probation; 17CF194, Cts. 3 and 4>>1 year probation on each count; All Probation terms concurrent to each other.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treament/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO including but not limited to AODA and any follow up; Absolute sobriety; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or for any week defendant does not comply with that condition, she must complete 9 hours of CS per week; DNA Sample and surcharge; CC.

In the event of revocation, defendant is entitled to credit as follows>> 17CF194 - 1 day; 15CF1037 - 4 days.
